revised_title: Tectonic Stress in the Lithosphere: Forces Driving the Plates
tldr: This article examines the forces driving the plates in the lithosphere, using plate kinematics and stress observations. The authors find that the forces are largely balanced between drag and slab-pull, and that the torquc balance model can be used to describe the evolution of plate dynamics over the Cenozoic Era. The study focuses on the North and South American plates, comparing stress models with stress orientations to better understand the forces at play.
